data.title: A long time family favorite
data.text: I have grown up eating here. The food is always delicious and the staff is friendly and efficient. One of our favorite places to eat.

data.title: Good solid place to eat.
data.text:
I enjoyed the fish and chips(fries). They're made with cod which means they're more moist than some fish when cooked in batter. 
The ceiling is a little low because it's in the basement but there is also in outside patio option. Staff did a great job. They have a good selection of homemade pies if you leave room for it.

data.title: Great lunch.
data.text: Good service, generous portions.  Definitely glad we went.  Pork tenderloin was really enough for two.

data.title: Great place to eat
data.text:
We went to this restaurant for lunch based on the referral of a local.  Turns out the local was right on.  
Kind of a unique cool looking place.
The service was great, The food wonderful.  The prices reasonable.
In fact from that we went back for lunch the next day with the same great experience again.
If we ever go back to Independence we would eat there again.

data.title: A little old fashioned restaurant
data.text: Most people would not know this restaurant is there as you have to go through a doorway and then down stairs but it is worth it.  This has been here for a lot of years but the good food and service remains the same.  Highly recommend going there.

data.title: Loved it!
data.text: The food was amazing, plus the waitor, James...was so sweet. I wanted to become best friends with him.

data.title: The Best Pork Tenderloin Sandwiches!
data.text:
I've been to the Court House Exchange several times and have ordered various items from the menu and enjoyed everything I have ordered, but by far, they serve the best pork tenderloin sandwiches ever. They are not only very tasty, but huge!

I always enjoy the unique atmosphere and friendly the service. I tell everyone, "Try the Court House Exchange, they have the best Tenderloin Sandwich!

data.title: Good food; nice environment.
data.text: My husband and I often eat here when we travel to Independence.  The staff is generally friendly, and the food is good, especially the burgers.  I would recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Delicious supper
data.text: While visiting family in the area, we ate supper here. The staff was nice and we all enjoyed our meals and the service was great too. I had a chicken cutlet dinner very juicy and delicious and the rest of our group were very empreesed by their meals as well.

data.title: Good Food; Friendly but slow service
data.text: If you want good food and are okay with laid-back service, this is the place.  The menu is quite varied, and the restaurant seems to be popular with the locals.  Desserts are plentiful and most are homemade, so save some room for that if you like dessert at all.  Prices are reasonable.

data.title: Friendly restaurant
data.text: We stopped and grabbed a beer while waiting for our Uber drive to come pick us up. It is a really cool restaurant down in the basement. We didn't eat but it was starting to get busy on a Friday evening. It seems to be very popular with the locals.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Great ambience and excellent service.  The shrimps were fantastic and the bread & butter pudding, superb.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: When we arrived at nearly 1:30 P.M., we had to wait a few minutes to be acknowledged and seated. When we were seated, a young man came to take our drink order. I'm assuming that he was a busboy as he was unfamiliar with drink options (didn't know what non-alcoholic beverages were available or what grenadine was). Our waitress finally arrived and wasn't very friendly. When my husband asked what the restaurant was known for, she responded with "Everything. Everything is good". She seemed rushed and just wanted us to hurry up and order, although the lunch crowd had thinned greatly. We ordered an appetizer of Fried Pickle Chips and meals of a Santa Fe Burger and the Smokehouse Club sandwich. The food was wonderful! What the Smokehouse lacked in size, it made up for in taste. As our visit continued, our server's attitude lightened up and she was more pleasant. For 2 sodas (refilled once each), appetizer, and 2 entrees, we paid just over $30. Good food, good value, OK atmosphere and service.

data.title: Great recommendation from local
data.text: We stopped in Independence to visit Truman's home and library. While waiting for our tour we decided to eat lunch. We stopped at the soda shop but they didn't have hot meals. However, they were nice to direct us to the Courthouse Exchange. The restaurant had nice ambiance and the food was delicious and well priced. The service was attentive and pleasant. We highly recommend it.

data.title: Hidden..gem
data.text: It was walking distance from the court house. I got the fish sandwich. Nice and hot, it was good,just a tad fishy...to my liking.

data.title: Very disappointing
data.text: We ate at the Court House Exchange after a visit to the Truman Museum. The specials of the day were Liver and Onions and Turkey  real turkey carved from I chose the turkey after asking the waiter if it was f rom a bird or from a turkey breast. He said it was from a breast bit I decided to have it anyway.........bad mistake. It was actually a hot turkey sandwich made from turkey cold cuts with mashed potatoes and gravy and a scoop of cold cornbread stuffing covered with gravy, no vegetable came with it. My husband asked if the liver was thick enough to be cooked medium rare and he was assured that it was. When it arrived it was paper thin and resembled shoe leather, his side salad was just lettuce.........no tomato, no cucumber, no nothing!. In fairness, our friend had the fried chicken and he said that was very good. If we hadn't asked about the details, I would just chalk it up to an error on our part/bad selections, but we asked and I feel we were seriously mislead.

data.title: A hidden gem on Independence square
data.text: My dad took me to the Court House for the first time. I never even knew the place was on the square but I was happy with service, food, and ambiance of this place. I can't wait to go back, the menu had so many options and I was so full I couldn't eat a slice of pie. I had the Ruben sandwich and it had the perfect blend of meat, kraut, and dressing. My dad had the philly cheese steak and it looked good as well. I highly recommend Court House Exchange.

data.title: Little dark but good food
data.text: We have been several times to the restaurant and never had a bad meal.  Everything is made from scratch and you can tell.  Friendly service and kind of fun with all the old pictures on the walls.

data.title: Dark den but yummy
data.text: I haven't had French dressing this good in a long time. One trip salad and a SW chicken wrap.  All was very good.   Friendly service.

data.title: Yummy Burgers
data.text: This restaurant has awesome burgers, salad, club, everything! Lots of homemade items from what I am told.  Fun place to eat and visit with friends.  Quick service!
